citation.article-title: Roseibaca ekhonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an alkalitolerant and aerobic bacteriochlorophyll a-producing alphaproteobacterium from hypersaline Ekho Lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Roseibaca (Ro.se.i.bac′a. L. adj. roseus rose-coloured; L. fem. n. baca berry; N.L. fem. n. Roseibaca the rose-coloured berry, recognizing the close relationship to the anaerobic bchl a-producing genus Rhodobaca).
One or both cell poles are narrower.
Cell growth is monopolar indicating a budding process.
Cells have a tendency to form rosettes and contain numerous fimbriae on their surface.
Cells contain poly-β-hydroxy butyrate and do not form endospores.
Alkalitolerant; cells have an absolute requirement for Na+.
Do not grow photoautotrophically with H2/CO2 (80 : 20, by vol.) or photo-organotrophically with acetate or glutamate.
Diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phospatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylcholine are present, but phosphatidylmonomethylamine is not.
The dominant cellular fatty acid is 18 : 1ω7c, with 3-OH 14 : 1, 16 : 1ω9c, 16 : 0 and 18 : 1ω9c present in lower amounts.
The type species is Roseibaca ekhonensis.
